questions.question: What does the `<progress>` element represent in HTML5?
options: A progress bar for representing the completion of a task.
A way to show download speed.
questions.answer: A progress bar for representing the completion of a task.

questions.question: Which attribute is used to specify a default option in a dropdown list?
What does the `accept` attribute do in a file input element?
options: Specifies the types of files that can be uploaded.
Sets the file formats allowed for download.
Indicates if the input is required.
questions.answer: Specifies the types of files that can be uploaded.

questions.question: How can you add an icon to a button in HTML?
options: By including an image inside the `<button>` element.
By setting the `src` attribute in a button tag.
By using a CSS background image.
questions.answer: By including an image inside the `<button>` element.

questions.question: Which HTML element is used to define a footer for a document or section?
What is the purpose of the `content` attribute in the `<meta>` tag?
options: To specify the character set for the document.
To provide metadata about the HTML document.
questions.answer: To provide metadata about the HTML document.

questions.question: What is the role of the `<aside>` element in HTML5?
options: To represent content related to the main content but not essential.
To define the main content of the page.
questions.answer: To represent content related to the main content but not essential.

questions.question: Which HTML element is used to create a clickable hyperlink?
How do you create a checkbox input in HTML?
What is the use of the `<blockquote>` element?
options: To define a section that is quoted from another source.
To create a list of items.
To define the main title of a page.
questions.answer: To define a section that is quoted from another source.
